str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) trans: I drive (on), propel, (b) intrans: I row. A prolonged form of a primary verb of uncertain affinity; to push.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Twenty. Of uncertain affinity; a score.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
